001package io.github.ai4ci.output;
002
003import java.util.stream.Stream;
004
005import org.immutables.value.Value;
006
007import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Outbreak;
008import io.github.ai4ci.flow.output.CSVWriter;
009import io.github.ai4ci.flow.output.Export;
010import io.github.ai4ci.flow.output.Export.Stage;
011
012/**
013 * Infectivity profile records exported at baseline.
014 *
015 * <p>
016 * Main purpose: record the infectivity profile used by the outbreak baseline as
017 * a time indexed distribution. Records are produced during the BASELINE stage
018 * and exported per model to a CSV file ({@code ip.csv}).
019 *
020 * <p>
021 * Downstream uses: used by plotting utilities, analytic pipelines and any code
022 * that reconstructs perâ€‘time infectivity curves for sensitivity analysis.
023 *
024 * @author Rob Challen
025 */
026@Value.Immutable
027@Export(
028                stage = Stage.BASELINE,
029                value = "ip.csv",
030                size = 16,
031                selector = InfectivityProfileCSV.Selector.class,
032                writer = CSVWriter.class
033)
034public interface InfectivityProfileCSV extends CommonCSV.Model {
035
036        /**
037         * Selector class implements Export.Selector to provide infectivity profile
038         * extraction from Outbreak simulations. Retrieves infectivity profile data
039         * using CSVMapper for CSV serialization.
040         */
041        static class Selector implements Export.Selector {
042                @Override
043                public Stream<InfectivityProfileCSV> apply(Outbreak o) {
044                        return CSVMapper.INSTANCE.infectivityProfile(o);
045                }
046        }
047
048        /**
049         * Probability of transmission at the given time step.
050         *
051         * @return the infection probability (density) at the given time step; values
052         *         are typically normalised so that the profile integrates to the
053         *         baseline infectiousness over the infectious period
054         */
055        double getProbability();
056
057        /**
058         * Time step in the infectivity profile.
059         *
060         * @return the time step index (tau) corresponding to the probability value
061         */
062        int getTau();
063
064}
